channel.title: tools on Monash Bioinformatics Platform
channel.description: Recent content in tools on Monash Bioinformatics Platform

item.title: Singscore for gene-set scoring in cancer research
item.description: The recent decade has seen a massive growth in the availability of large transcriptomic data sets for cell line collections (e.g. the Cancer Cell Line Encyclopedia; CCLE), and patient tumour samples with matched clinical information (e.g. The Cancer Genome Atlas; TCGA)

item.title: Beggars at a banquet: stop only thinking about significance and start thinking about measurement accuracy with topconfects
item.description: Paul Harrison Monash Bioinformatics Platform RNA System laboratory Abstract In this talk I will describe ranking and selecting differentially expressed genes based on confidence bounds on the log fold change, while still properly adjusting for multiple-testing, using my Bioconductor package “topconfects”.

item.title: Bacterial whole genome assembly of Oxford Nanopore reads
item.description: Long-read sequencing platforms from Oxford Nanopore Technologies (ONT) are transforming the world of genome assembly

item.title: Nanopore squiggle adventures
item.description: The management of raw nanopore sequencing data poses a challenge that must be overcome to accelerate the development of new bioinformatics algorithms predicated on signal analysis

item.title: Mitch: Multivariate pathway enrichment for multi-omics and single-cell profiling data
item.description: Inference of biological pathway activity via gene set enrichment analysis is a frequently used approach in the interpretation of clinical and other omics data

item.title: crisscrosslinkeR: An R package for the identification and visualization of protein–RNA and protein–protein interactions captured by crosslinking with mass spectrometry
item.description: Unbiased detection of protein–protein and protein–RNA interactions within ribonucleoprotein complexes are enabled through crosslinking with mass spectrometry, but different methods detect different types of molecular interactions

item.title: A suite of Bioinformatics tools to call and explore time-course mutations from RNA-Seq
item.description: RNA Sequencing allows researchers to study the cancer genome from different perspectives than just differential expression analyses

item.title: Classifying DNA mismatch repair variant pathogenicity using protein structure and function predictions
item.description: The DNA mismatch repair (MMR) mechanism plays an important role in maintaining genome integrity by correcting small mutations that can arise from DNA damage or from mistakes made during replication and recombination
